pullRequest.body:
Basic smallness properties (with respect to universe) for modules and algebras.


---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

nodes.body:
### PR summary [75b51b22fb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22911/commits/75b51b22fb234b7031d2300133c68b6265e685c2)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.Finiteness.Small` (new file)|1260|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ FG.small`
`+ Finite.small`
`+ FiniteType.small`
`+ _root_.Subalgebra.FG.small`
`+ instance : Inhabited {P : Submodule R M // Small.{u} P}`
`+ instance : SemilatticeSup {P : Submodule R M // Small.{u} P}`
`+ small_adjoin`
`+ small_iSup`
`+ small_span`
`+ small_span_singleton`
`+ small_sup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Looking at the existing library for `Small` (e.g [small_iUnion](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Small/Set.html#small_iUnion)), I think that most of these should be instances and most of the `Small` arguments should be typeclass arguments. Of course in some cases this will require declaring extra local instances, but I expect it to be worth it, and in any case consistency has its own value.

The exceptions are those who take some non-typeclass argument, typically the `FG` ones.

Doesn't `inferInstance` find this? By going through [Countable.toSmall](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Countable/Small.html#Countable.toSmall) and [Subsingleton.to_countable](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/Countable/Defs.html#Subsingleton.to_countable).
Is [DFinsupp.small](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Data/DFinsupp/Small.html#DFinsupp.small) not good enough? I haven't checked the universes but it looks similar.
I think you should be able to use [Submodule.span_iUnion](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Span/Defs.html#Submodule.span_iUnion) here.
Could you add the [Module.Finite](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Finiteness/Defs.html#Module.Finite) version of this?
I don't think you should change it, but note that you could have avoided named arguments simply by adding `have := P.property; have := Q.property; `
Yes, but then I couldn't have a one-line proof…

Apparently this already exists as [Module.Finite.small](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Finiteness/Cardinality.html#Module.Finite.small), sorry for not checking carefully enough... 

Although the existing proof is nice enough, I think going through `Submodule.FG` and grouping things together makes more sense, so can you remove the existing theorem and rename this to `Module.Finite.small` ?
I hope I won't have too many things to change.

If you add these (in the appropriate files):
```lean
instance _root_.Finsupp.small {σ : Type*} {R : Type*} [Zero R]
    [Small.{u} R] [Small.{u} σ] :
    Small.{u} (σ →₀ R) := by
  classical
  exact small_map finsuppEquivDFinsupp

instance _root_.MvPolynomial.small {σ : Type*} {R : Type*} [CommSemiring R]
    [Small.{u} R] [Small.{u} σ] :
    Small.{u} (MvPolynomial σ R) :=
  inferInstanceAs (Small.{u} ((σ →₀ ℕ) →₀ R))
```
You can do:
```suggestion
  rw [Algebra.adjoin_eq_range]
  apply small_range
```

pullRequest.title: feat(RingTheory/Finiteness/Small): smallness properties of modules and algebras

source.title: feat(RingTheory/Finiteness/Small): tensor product of the system of small submodules

nodes.body:
Looking at the existing library for `Small` (e.g [small_iUnion](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Small/Set.html#small_iUnion)), I think that most of these should be instances and most of the `Small` arguments should be typeclass arguments. Of course in some cases this will require declaring extra local instances, but I expect it to be worth it, and in any case consistency has its own value.

The exceptions are those who take some non-typeclass argument, typically the `FG` ones.
